summary: Evelio Duque is a Cuban citizen who arrived in Quito, Ecuador, in 1966. He is mentioned in several cables from 1973, indicating involvement in anti-Castro activities. There are also potential connections to drug trafficking, specifically a meeting with drug trafficker Alfredo Ordonez Gonzalez in Central America. The documents suggest affiliations with exile groups, though the specific groups are not consistently named. The cables request traces on Duque, indicating an intelligence interest in his activities and connections.
significance: Based on the available documents, Evelio Duque's significance in the JFK assassination context is not directly apparent. His involvement in anti-Castro activities and potential connections to drug trafficking are mentioned, but there is no explicit link to the assassination in these documents. Further investigation would be needed to determine if these activities or connections have any relevance to the JFK assassination.
